title: (x) new Opel font - proprietary
content:
Hi,   
   
I'm searching for the new Opel-Font from Robin Nicholas.   
   
I need the name of the font or better a download link to it.   
   
You can see some pictures here: [http://www.fonts.com/fontservices/services\_home.asp?nCo=AFMT&con=casestudy-opel&page=1](http://web.archive.org/web/20091213032034/http:/www.fonts.com/fontservices/services_home.asp?nCo=AFMT&con=casestudy-opel&page=1)   
   
spot99
author: anonymous

comments.content:
It's proprietary, you can't access it. That's the whole point   
of having a custom font designed: nobody else can use it.   
Can't be helped.

BTW Why do you need it? Frankly it's not very good,   
don't you think?

I want to make a preview image of a website for a Opel car dealer.   
So the original font looks good on such website.

but on another thread i read, it's "available via agfa monotype"   
   
 [http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/14494.html?1061554318](http://web.archive.org/web/20091213032034/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/14494.html?1061554318)

Uh-uh, that's probably a misunderstanding from Lars.   
This typeface has never been made available to the   
general public. If a preview image is all you need to   
make, use [Metro](http://web.archive.org/web/20091213032034/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/metro-2/) | [Geometric 415](http://web.archive.org/web/20091213032034/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/geometric-415/) for now.
